intro: Bootia saponaria, commonly known as soapwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Bootia saponaria has a long history of use in traditional medicine and as a source of saponins, which are natural detergents.
